definition: to take countermeasures against/to hit back/to counter
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: As a counter-measure, they impose duties under the multilateral WTO regime.
sentences.chinese: 作爲反制措施，他們在WTO多邊機制下徵收稅收。

sentences.english: Counterspell no longer generates a high amount of threat.
sentences.chinese: 法術反制不再造成較高的威脅值。

sentences.english: Also both often cooperate in the UNSC to counter Western-European influence.
sentences.chinese: 此外，兩國經常在安理會合作一起反制西歐影響。

sentences.english: Russians are using electronic conter measures to jam our confict guilding systems.
sentences.chinese: 俄國人使用電子反制措施干擾了我們的戰場制導系統。

sentences.english: Improved Counterspell now is a Tier 1 talent. Down from Tier 3.
sentences.chinese: 強化法術反制由三階天賦降爲一階天賦。

definition: to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to use force/to come to blows
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
